dfischer.utils

Class ExecutionPlanValidateArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ExecutionPlanValidateArgs
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExecutionPlanValidateCommandArgs, ExecutionPlanValidateFunctionArgs

    public class ExecutionPlanValidateArgs
extends java.lang.Object
    A library that supports the validation of arguments for execution plan functions and commands.
    Since:
    V5.5-D

                                              java.lang.String sourceLine)
                                                       throws ExecutionPlanSyntaxException
        Validate the value of a natural number argument (1, 2, 3 ..).
        Parameters:
        naturalNumberArgument - the value of the argument
        argumentNumber - the number of the argument (1..n)
        lineNumber - the line number of the execution plan line (1..n)
        sourceLine - the source code of the execution plan line
        Throws:
        ExecutionPlanSyntaxException

      • validateTimeArgumentValue

        public static void validateTimeArgumentValue(java.lang.String timeArgument,
                             int argumentNumber,
                             int lineNumber,
                             java.lang.String sourceLine)
                                      throws ExecutionPlanSyntaxException
        Validate the value of a time argument which is in the format <hours>:<minutes>:<seconds>.<milliseconds>. Note that all partial values can extend their unit range. So it's for example allowed to specify 75 minutes. If the passed (String) value is invalid then an ExecutionPlanSyntaxException is thrown. Negative times are not supported. Specifying the number of seconds is always required. All other time units are optional. Examples: 
         0.10 = 10 milliseconds
 .500 = 500 milliseconds
 0.3600 = 3600 milliseconds
 1.3600 = one second and 3600 milliseconds = 4600 milliseconds
 30 = 30 seconds
 180 = 180 seconds
 5:0 = 5 minutes
 75:0 = 75 minutes
 2:30 = two minutes and 30 seconds
 2:0:0 = two hours
 1:30:40.100 = one hour and 30 minutes and 40 seconds and 100 milliseconds
        Parameters:
        timeArgument - the value of the argument
        argumentNumber - the number of the argument (1..n)
        lineNumber - the line number of the execution plan line (1..n)
        sourceLine - the source code of the execution plan line
        Throws:
        ExecutionPlanSyntaxException
        See Also:
        ExecutionPlanLib.getTimeArgumentValue(String)
